newsitem.title: USA: Affinity to sell units to Century.
newsitem.headline: Affinity to sell units to Century.

text.p: Affinity Entertainment Inc said Friday it has agreed to sell its wholly owned subsidiaries Affinity Television Inc and Broadcast Edit Inc to Century Technologies Inc.
As part of the deal, Affinity will return 30 million of the 37.5 million units of Century stock that it had purchased according to a stock purchase agreement dated October 31, 1996.
Affinity will also cancel its $2.4 million note due to Century.
Affinity will retain 7.5 million units of Century, which it will distribute as a stock dividend to all shareholders of record as of October 1.

Affinity said the decision to sell its television division was made when a financing it had arranged for the production of its fall programming was defaulted on by the investment group after an initial payment was received.
